A computational tool for studying structure and thermodynamics of water molecules on solute surfaces, developed at Kurtzman Lab.

SSTMap Solvation Structure and Thermodynamic Mapping

Examples of SSTMap Calculations

03 May 2017

The simplest way to run SSTMap is by its command-line tools; run_hsa and run_gist that provide side-based and grid-based calculations of solvation structure and thermodynamics. Here are some examples of running these tools on MD simulations generated by various packages.


Read More

Getting Started with SSTMap

02 May 2017

The main requirement for installation of SSTMap is the anaconda python distribution. If you are not familiar with Anaconda, please have a look at continuum.io/why-anaconda.
